body.p:
Owingsville
June 7th 1865
D W. Lindsay
Adjt Gen of Ky
Sir

Your note of the 3d Inst is at hand -- The Sheff has the warrant for Warren? Arrest & he Just tells me that he can not get men to go when summoned to form the Posse Commitatus They will not go -- I learned on what I thought was reliable authority that warren had gone out of the County & was in Flemingsburg with his father a few days since but the sheff thinks that he is still in the county
-- The U. S. M. Authorities sent one Downs here or at least to Mt Sterling & delivered him to our Sheff on Bench Warrant & he is now in Jail -- Bail $250 -- Some of his friends talk about giving it -- If they do not the Jail will be broken & he taken out
The sheff wants Barbers men to arrest another man out here some 6 miles for whom he has a Bench Warrant Barbers men have not come to the time of writing this

I tell you what I will do I will write Judge Apperson & have him hold a special Term & try em all That is the
best --
my opinion is that the authorities will take warren and all the ballance if sustained
Sheff has Just came across from his office to tell me that Barbers men can do but little good unless mounted

Owingsville, Ky
June 7th 1865
Lacy B. D
Says the Sheriff has a warrant of arrest for Warren -- Can get no men to go when summoned to form the "posse Commitatus" asks for aid from Barbers men -- will be of no service without being mounted.

L B No 13 -- 1865 P. 279
Recd A. G. O. June 8" 1865
